clauses.body_md:
# SIMPLE AGREEMENT FOR FUTURE EQUITY

**THIS CERTIFIES THAT** in exchange for the payment by {{investor_name}} (the "**Investor**") of £{{purchase_amount}} (the "**Purchase Amount**") on or about {{date}}, {{company_name}}, a company incorporated in {{company_jurisdiction}} (registered number: [●]) (the "**Company**"), issues to the Investor the right to certain shares of the Company's share capital, subject to the terms described below.

**IMPORTANT NOTE**: This agreement must comply with the Companies Act 2006 and applicable FCA regulations if the Company or Investor is FCA-regulated.

"**Share Capital**" means the ordinary and preference shares of the Company.

"**Change of Control**" means (i) a transaction or series of related transactions in which any person or group of persons acting in concert becomes entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting rights exercisable at general meetings of the Company, (ii) any scheme of arrangement, merger or consolidation of the Company (other than a transaction in which the holders of shares in the Company immediately prior to such transaction retain at least a majority of the voting rights in the surviving entity immediately after such transaction), or (iii) a sale or other disposal of all or substantially all of the undertaking and assets of the Company.

"**Dissolution Event**" means (i) a members' voluntary liquidation, (ii) a creditors' voluntary liquidation, (iii) compulsory liquidation or (iv) administration or any other insolvency proceeding under the Insolvency Act 1986.

"**Equity Financing**" means a bona fide transaction or series of transactions with the principal purpose of raising capital, pursuant to which the Company issues and allots preference shares at a fixed pre-money valuation.

"**Liquidity Capitalisation**" means the number, as of immediately prior to the Liquidity Event, of shares (on an as-converted basis) in issue, assuming exercise or conversion of all outstanding vested and unvested options, warrants and other convertible securities (including under any EMI, CSOP or other employee share scheme), but excluding (i) shares reserved and available for future grant under any equity incentive or similar plan, (ii) this instrument, (iii) other convertible loan notes, and (iv) convertible securities that are not actually convertible or exercisable in connection with the Liquidity Event.

"**Liquidity Event**" means a Change of Control or an initial public offering (IPO) of the Company's ordinary shares on a recognised stock exchange.

"**Liquidity Price**" means the price per share equal to the Valuation Cap divided by the Liquidity Capitalisation.

"**Post-Money Valuation Cap**" means £{{valuation_cap}}.

"**Safe**" means this instrument.

"**Safe Preference Shares**" means the shares of a class of preference shares issued to the Investor in an Equity Financing, having the identical rights, privileges, preferences and restrictions as the Standard Preference Shares, other than with respect to: (i) the per share liquidation preference and the conversion price for purposes of price-based anti-dilution protection, which will equal the Safe Price; and (ii) the basis for any dividend rights, which will be based on the Safe Price.

"**Safe Price**" means the price per share equal to the Post-Money Valuation Cap divided by the Company Capitalisation.

"**Standard Preference Shares**" means the shares of a class of preference shares issued to investors investing new money in the Company in connection with the initial completion of the Equity Financing.

Note: consideration for shares must comply with CA 2006 s.580-609. Ensure Articles of Association permit the creation and rights of preference shares.
